intro: Psychotria tubulosa, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. It has a unique root system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. Psychotria tubulosa is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its ecological importance in its native habitat.
